jobs.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack - Reporting
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us: 

We’re seeking several Software Engineers with full stack (any mix of front end, backend, and database) experience to join our team building the future of radiology. These roles will work alongside our high-performing cross-functional team of Full Stack Engineers, ML Engineers, and Product Leaders, and various other teams internally and externally to develop this responsive and performant application.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Develop on large-scale progressive and single page web applications that streamline user workflows and increase their efficiency and effectiveness

  • Work on a modern Javascript (React/Typescript) frontend application 

  • Develop our Python, FastAPI backend services including a REST API and ML pipeline services 

  • Build new features that support our rapidly growing number of customers

  • Write code that meets our internal standards for security, style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale HIPAA web environment

  • Work with Product Management, UX, Customer Success and other stakeholders to iterate on new features and address defects

  • Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance that have a particular impact across your team

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 2+ years of industry full stack engineering experience with single and multi-tenanted environments

  • In-depth knowledge of Javascript / TypeScript, Python and FastAPI, or equivalent modern languages/frameworks

  • Knowledge of relational and document based databases, as well as other large scale data storage paradigms

  • Knowledge of modern web architecture and best practices

  • Fluency with HTML, CSS, responsive design, and other related web technologies

  • Familiarity with cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, browser networking, and browser APIs such as IndexedDB and WebSockets.

  • Experience with unit and integration testing, test-driven development preferred

  • Experience working on a distributed team and strong version control skills using git

  • Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to diagnose and prevent these problems

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience with Typescript and React

  • Experience with Python, FastAPI, Starlette, SQLAlchemy

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

  • Experience with 3rd-party integrations such as Auth0, Amplitude

  • Experience working at an early-stage startup

  • Experience in a HIPAA-compliant environment, especially with FHIR and HL7

  • Experience working on machine learning

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

  • For roles based outside the US, your recruiter can share more details

At Rad AI, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our recruiters will use email addresses with the domain @radai.com or no-reply@ashbyhq.com.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer, Full Stack - Platform

Why Join Us:

We're looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join our platform team and help build and maintain our healthcare data platform. In this role, you'll develop tools and systems that power mission-critical products like our Reporting application, working with platforms like Medplum and health data formats such as HL7.

You'll play a key role in designing and supporting the backend infrastructure that connects directly to the products we deliver to customers. The role is backend-heavy and ideal for someone who thrives on building robust, scalable systems in Python and TypeScript.

This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of engineering and healthcare, shaping how healthcare data flows across the company.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Develop on large-scale progressive and single page web applications that streamline user workflows and increase their efficiency and effectiveness

  • Build new features that support our rapidly growing number of customers

  • Write code that meets our internal standards for security, style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale HIPAA web environment

  • Work with Product Management, UX, Customer Success and other stakeholders to iterate on new features and address defects

  • Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance that have a particular impact across your team

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 8+ years of industry full stack engineering experience with single and multi-tenanted environments

  • In-depth knowledge of Javascript / TypeScript, Python and FastAPI, or equivalent modern languages/frameworks

  • Knowledge of relational and document based databases, as well as other large scale data storage paradigms

  • Knowledge of modern web architecture and best practices

  • Fluency with HTML, CSS, responsive design, and other related web technologies

  • Familiarity with cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, browser networking, and browser APIs such as IndexedDB and WebSockets

  • Experience with unit and integration testing

  • Experience working on a distributed team and strong version control skills using git

  • Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to diagnose and prevent these problems

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with React

  • Experience with Starlette, SQLAlchemy

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

  • Experience with 3rd-party integrations such as Auth0, Amplitude

  • Experience working at an early-stage startup

  • Experience in a HIPAA-compliant environment, especially with FHIR and HL7

  • Experience working on machine learning

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Customer Success Manager to join our small but growing team. In this high-visibility role, you’ll deliver unmatched service and attention to our rapidly expanding customer base of radiology groups and hospital systems—helping drive success at the forefront of generative AI-driven healthcare innovation.

The ideal candidate has a proven track record of driving customer adoption, retention, and expansion within high-growth healthcare AI and SaaS companies. This role will be responsible for building strong relationships with customers, ensuring successful onboarding and implementation, proactively addressing customer needs, fostering cross-functional collaboration to maximize customer value, and turning customers into enthusiastic advocates.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to Rad AI’s customers through the entire post-sale lifecycle including onboarding, product adoption, and renewal.

  • Develop and maintain customer relationships across our radiology partners. Proactively manage the customer relationships through regularly scheduled check-in meetings to determine product usage and customer feedback.

  • Become the trusted partner for the customer on use-case and product functionality. Represent the voice of the customer to our Product and Machine Learning teams.

  • Ensure a smooth onboarding experience for new radiology partners by engaging and educating IT, executive leadership, and radiologists.

  • Help customers maximize the value of their Rad AI subscription by guiding them to adoption and expansion strategies tailored to their practice.

  • Monitor customer accounts to ensure fast response to customer queries and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

  • Drive retention and growth among our customers by understanding their business needs and demonstrating Rad AI products’ value.

  • Take an active role in building out a world class customer success organization that aims to exceed customer expectations with attentive, responsive, and knowledgeable service.

Who We're Looking For:

  • Bachelor’s degree or above.

  • 3+ years of relevant customer success experience within a healthcare environment.

  • Excellent people/relationship management, coaching, and communication skills with the ability to influence others.

  • Strong project management and organizational skills to prioritize competing priorities, deliver outcomes on a timeline, and build out documentation.

  • Practical working knowledge of SaaS solutions, implementations, and technical concepts.

  • Eagerness to continuously learn, adapt, improve, and help others do so in a fast paced, ever changing environment.

  • Ability to build and maintain relationships with all functions and areas of the company to share in challenges and successes, and work collaboratively towards common goals.

  • Ability to work in the Pacific Time zone.

Nice To Haves:

  • Experience in a high-growth startup environment.

  • Demonstrated record of identifying expansion and cross-sell opportunities.

  • Knowledge of the healthcare industry and AI technology.

  • Prior professional consulting or healthcare software implementation experience.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

  • For roles based outside the US, your recruiter can share more details

At Rad AI, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our recruiters will use email addresses with the domain @radai.com or no-reply@ashbyhq.com.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We are seeking an experienced Commercial Counsel to join our team. In this high-visibility role, you will be a key contributor to our legal strategy and operations, collaborating closely with commercial teams and senior leaders to advance our mission. Your guidance will be essential as we navigate complex legal challenges, providing critical expertise that fosters innovation and growth while upholding the highest standards of compliance and ethics.

Your legal insights will help accelerate the deployment of innovative products, strengthen collaboration with physicians, and reinforce important partnerships. Additionally, you will play a central role in protecting our relationships with healthcare partners, safeguarding our intellectual property, and building lasting trust with physicians, executive leaders, and other key stakeholders.

What You'll be Doing:

  • Collaborate with the sales team to develop efficient processes that accelerate deal closures while maintaining rigorous legal standards.

  • Negotiate commercial contracts to enable the delivery of our AI solutions to healthcare providers globally.

  • Design and implement a comprehensive privacy program ensuring full compliance with HIPAA and all Business Associate Agreements (BAAs), safeguarding sensitive medical data in partnership with our security and product teams.

  • Serve as a trusted counsel across product, engineering, and model teams, providing strategic legal support for AI research and model development projects.

  • Build scalable legal processes, tools, and infrastructure—including internal documentation and a modern legal tech stack—to support the company’s rapid growth.

  • Monitor emerging legal and policy trends in the generative AI landscape to ensure Rad AI remains at the forefront of regulatory compliance and innovation.

Who We’re Looking For:

  • Minimum of 5 years of legal experience, with at least 2 years focused on negotiating commercial contracts—ideally within a B2B SaaS environment.

  • Juris Doctor (JD) from an ABA-accredited institution and active membership in at least one U.S. state bar.

  • Background in healthcare technology or artificial intelligence, demonstrating a deep understanding of the distinctive legal challenges these sectors present.

  • Proven ability to navigate ambiguity and shape legal strategies within emerging fields.

  • Strong track record of building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, with adaptable communication styles that strike the right balance between business risk-taking and safeguarding organizational interests.

  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify and pursue opportunities for professional development and to contribute to new initiatives as Rad AI continues to expand—taking on challenging projects and adapting to evolving business needs.

Nice to Haves:

  • Knowledge of the healthcare industry and AI technology.

  • Previous experience working in a high-growth startup environment.

  • Passion for healthcare and/or mission-driven technology is a strong plus.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We’re seeking an elite Sales Enablement Manager to act as the strategic driver of sales excellence at Rad AI. Reporting directly to the RevOps leadership, you’ll design and execute a world-class enablement strategy that empowers our commercial team to consistently exceed targets.

This role bridges strategy and execution, ensuring our teams are equipped with the tools, content, and confidence to win complex deals across enterprise health systems and independent radiology groups. You’ll work cross-functionally with Product, Marketing, RevOps, and Customer Success to turn our go-to-market strategy into repeatable field execution.

What You'll Own:

  • Build the Enablement Function: Develop a scalable enablement roadmap aligned with revenue and growth goals.

  • Drive Field Productivity: Design and track enablement programs that increase win rates, shorten ramp time, and improve pipeline conversion.

  • Launch Excellence: Partner with Product and Marketing to ensure the field is ready for every new product, feature, and campaign.

  • Sales Content Engine: Oversee creation and distribution of high-impact collateral — from case studies and talk tracks to competitive battle cards and ROI tools.

  • Training & Onboarding: Architect onboarding that accelerates ramp time and ongoing learning programs that reinforce best practices.

  • Performance Insights: Use CRM and enablement platform data to measure program effectiveness and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

  • Cultural Leadership: Foster a high-performance, coaching-oriented culture where sellers are confident, competent, and customer-obsessed.

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 5+ years of experience in sales enablement, GTM programs, or sales operations within SaaS, healthtech, or enterprise B2B environments.

  • A builder, translator, and coach with the ability to turn complex challenges into simple, actionable strategies, drive results through hands-on execution, and inspire teams to achieve excellence.

  • Proven success building and scaling enablement programs that measurably improve sales performance.

  • Deep understanding of enterprise SaaS sales cycles; healthcare or AI/clinical workflow experience preferred.

  • Mastery of enablement tools and CRM systems (HubSpot preferred).

  • Strong analytical skills with ability to use data to influence and drive adoption.

  • Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills.

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience collaborating with executive teams in high-growth, Series B–C stage companies.

  • Knowledge of the healthcare industry and AI technology.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

The Role

Rad AI is seeking a visionary Vice President of People to champion our people strategy during a major phase of growth. Reporting directly to the CEO, this executive role is responsible for shaping our organizational culture, driving performance, and leading both senior HR Business Partners and recruiting teams. You’ll architect innovative people programs that help scale Rad AI through a major growth phase, building a workplace where energy, accountability, and positivity fuel exceptional results.

Key Responsibilities

  • Build, empower, and lead high-impact teams across HRBP and recruiting, ensuring operational excellence in every aspect of the People function.

  • Design and execute scalable strategies for talent planning, onboarding, and organizational development as Rad AI rapidly grows.

  • Drive adoption, continuous improvement, and innovation in performance management, raising the bar for individual and team achievement across the company.

  • Foster a vibrant, inclusive culture through energetic leadership, authentic communication, and processes that support growth, accountability, and belonging.

  • Lead remote and distributed workforce best practices across teams based in the US, Canada, and Latin America.

  • Partner with the executive team and senior leadership to align people programs with evolving business priorities and long-term vision.

  • Assess and enhance people processes using modern analytics, HR technologies (such as Rippling, Ashby, and Lattice), and data-driven insights.

  • Oversee compensation, succession planning, organizational structure, employee relations, and overall workforce strategy.

  • Champion new approaches and fresh ideas for engagement, retention, manager development, and employer branding—constantly innovating toward a best-in-class employee experience.

Who we’re looking for

  • 10+ years in People/HR leadership roles within fast-growth technology organizations (with direct success scaling through 100 to 500 to 1,000+ employees).

  • Proven experience building high-performance cultures and delivering modern, effective performance management frameworks.

  • Hands-on success managing senior HR Business Partners and recruiting teams.

  • Strong background in technology sector; SaaS and healthcare exposure is highly valued.

  • Clear, energizing communicator and influencer with a record of driving organizational change and business alignment.

  • Data-driven approach to people decisions, familiar with current HR analytics and tools.

It’s great if you have

  • Executive experience in SaaS or healthcare technology companies is a strong plus.

  • Background in scaling people functions through multiple cycles of rapid headcount growth, especially within smaller/startup environments versus large enterprises.

  • Familiarity with HRIS, ATS, and performance management platforms such as Rippling, Ashby, Lattice (or similar).

  • Experience leading remote teams distributed across North America and Latin America.

  • An energetic, positive, and innovative leadership style.

  • Interest in working hybrid in our SF Office

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

 - Champion new approaches and fresh ideas for engagement, retention, manager development, and employer branding—constantly innovating toward a best-in-class employee experience.


WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 10+ years in People/HR leadership roles within fast-growth technology organizations (with direct success scaling through 100 to 500 to 1,000+ employees).

 - Proven experience building high-performance cultures and delivering modern, effective performance management frameworks.

 - Hands-on success managing senior HR Business Partners and recruiting teams.

 - Strong background in technology sector; SaaS and healthcare exposure is highly valued.

 - Clear, energizing communicator and influencer with a record of driving organizational change and business alignment.

 - Data-driven approach to people decisions, familiar with current HR analytics and tools.


IT’S GREAT IF YOU HAVE

 - Executive experience in SaaS or healthcare technology companies is a strong plus.

 - Background in scaling people functions through multiple cycles of rapid headcount growth, especially within smaller/startup environments versus large enterprises.

 - Familiarity with HRIS, ATS, and performance management platforms such as Rippling, Ashby, Lattice (or similar).

 - Experience leading remote teams distributed across North America and Latin America.

 - An energetic, positive, and innovative leadership style.

 - Interest in working hybrid in our SF Office

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack - Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer with full stack (any mix of front end, backend, and database) experience to join our team building the future of radiology. This role will work alongside our high-performing cross-functional team of Full Stack Engineers, ML Engineers, Platform Engineers, and Product Leaders, and various other teams internally and externally to develop this responsive and performant application.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Develop on large-scale progressive and single page web applications that streamline user workflows and increase their efficiency and effectiveness

  • Work on a modern Javascript (React/Typescript) frontend application

  • Develop our Python, FastAPI backend services including a REST API and ML pipeline services

  • Build new features that support our rapidly growing number of customers

  • Write code that meets our internal standards for security, style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale HIPAA web environment

  • Work with Product Management, UX, Customer Success and other stakeholders to iterate on new features and address defects

  • Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance that have a particular impact across your team

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 5+ years of industry full stack engineering experience with single and multi-tenanted environments

  • In-depth knowledge of Javascript / TypeScript, Python and FastAPI, or equivalent modern languages/frameworks

  • Knowledge of relational and document based databases, as well as other large scale data storage paradigms

  • Knowledge of modern web architecture and best practices

  • Fluency with HTML, CSS, responsive design, and other related web technologies

  • Familiarity with cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, browser networking, and browser APIs such as IndexedDB and WebSockets.

  • Experience with unit and integration testing

  • Experience working on a distributed team and strong version control skills using git

  • Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to diagnose and prevent these problems

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience with React

  • Experience with Starlette, SQLAlchemy

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

  • Experience with 3rd-party integrations such as Auth0, Amplitude

  • Experience working at an early-stage startup

  • Experience in a HIPAA-compliant environment, especially with FHIR and HL7

  • Experience working on machine learning

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

jobs.title: Regional Vice President of Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We are looking for a dynamic sales executive to join our high-performing sales team. In this role you will own a territory and drive growth within health systems and physician groups across Rad AI's new and existing product lines. You will be expected to act as a GM of your territory, understanding all aspects of the business and the opportunity within the territory. You will need to navigate the complex relationships between health systems and physician groups and be able to forecast opportunities accurately to ensure that you meet or exceed quota.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Own the sales process for a large territory with a focus on finalizing new partnerships, from initial prospecting to contract closure. This will be a front-line sales position in the near term with the opportunity to build a team around you as we expand.

  • Work collaboratively with our customer success colleagues to ensure successful deployments and expansion of our partnerships.

  • Develop relationships with C-Level executives and decision makers (physician leaders, IT staff, RIS/PACS administrators, radiology directors, etc)

  • Meet or exceed the annual revenue quota

  • Develop and maintain a strong sales pipeline with more than enough opportunities to achieve your quota

  • Develop relationships both on the clinical and operational side of target accounts in order to properly present and sell meaningful solutions

  • Manage a pipeline including account targeting, deal qualification and prioritization, and accurate forecasting

  • Develop new relationships within your account base of radiologists and educate them on Rad AI’s impact to clinicians and patients alike

  • Build and maintain a deep and comprehensive familiarity of Rad AI’s products and development roadmap

Who We're Looking For:

  • 7+ years of direct sales experience, with 3+ years of full cycle healthcare SaaS sales experience

  • Demonstrated track record of successful sales and reaching or exceeding KPIs

  • Action orientation, fast moving and intrinsically motivated

  • A strong focus on delivery results and outcomes

Preferred Skills:

  • Prior AI sales experience at a growing healthcare startup company

  • Experience selling to large-scale healthcare system customers in the Pacific Northwest

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Integrations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why This Role Matters:

As a Senior Product Manager, Integrations at Rad AI, you’ll lead the definition and execution of our most technically complex initiatives—those that sit at the intersection of AI, healthcare & radiology workflows, and deep system integrations. Your work will directly impact how healthcare organizations adopt and scale our products across RIS, PACS, and EHR platforms.

You’ll partner with engineers, data scientists, designers, and customers to build deeply integrated, enterprise-grade software that improves radiologist efficiency and diagnostic accuracy. This is a high-ownership role where product strategy meets technical execution, and where domain knowledge in radiology integrations is not just valuable—it’s essential.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Lead product strategy and development for critical platform integrations with RIS, PACS, and EHR systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner, Visage, Intelerad).

  • Translate customer needs and regulatory requirements into technical product specifications and delivery plans.

  • Drive alignment between cross-functional teams on technical architecture, workflow impact, and customer rollout strategies.

  • Collaborate directly with healthcare IT teams, radiologists, and implementation leads to ensure seamless deployments in complex enterprise environments.

  • Own the success of your product area through rigorous prioritization, clear documentation, and continuous iteration.

  • Define KPIs, success metrics, and product health indicators across reliability, performance, and adoption.

  • Contribute to Rad AI’s broader platform strategy, bringing a systems mindset to interoperability, scalability, and clinical usability.

  • Stay current with industry standards (IHE, HL7, FHIR), regulatory considerations (HIPAA, SOC 2), and the evolving radiology vendor ecosystem.

Who You Are:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Biomedical Informatics, or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years of experience in product management, including 3+ years working on technical or platform-level products in healthcare or enterprise software.

  • Deep experience in healthcare integrations—you’ve worked hands-on with systems like Epic Radiant, PowerScribe, or PACS platforms, and understand the intricacies of real-time clinical workflows.

  • Hands-on mindset—you thrive in the details, whether it's writing technical product specs, mapping out integration flows, or debugging implementation blockers with engineering.

  • Excellent communicator—you can break down complex topics for both technical and non-technical audiences, and drive alignment among diverse stakeholders.

  • Customer-focused—you bring empathy for radiologists and healthcare IT teams, and a strong desire to solve real-world clinical problems.

  • Dynamic—you’re comfortable in fast-paced, evolving environments where priorities shift and your ability to deliver results is what sets you apart.

It’s a Plus if You Also Have:

  • Experience building healthcare SaaS products at a growth-stage company.

  • Familiarity with HL7, FHIR, DICOM, and IHE integration standards.

  • Experience with AI/ML-enabled software or data infrastructure.

  • Product ownership across multi-tenant or enterprise-scale platforms.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

  • For roles based outside the US, your recruiter can share more details

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our recruiters will use email addresses with the domain @radai.com or no-reply@ashbyhq.com.

This is a high-ownership role where product strategy meets technical execution, and where domain knowledge in radiology integrations is not just valuable—it’s essential.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

 - Lead product strategy and development for critical platform integrations with RIS, PACS, and EHR systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner, Visage, Intelerad).

 - Translate customer needs and regulatory requirements into technical product specifications and delivery plans.

 - Drive alignment between cross-functional teams on technical architecture, workflow impact, and customer rollout strategies.

 - Collaborate directly with healthcare IT teams, radiologists, and implementation leads to ensure seamless deployments in complex enterprise environments.

 - Own the success of your product area through rigorous prioritization, clear documentation, and continuous iteration.

 - Define KPIs, success metrics, and product health indicators across reliability, performance, and adoption.

 - Contribute to Rad AI’s broader platform strategy, bringing a systems mindset to interoperability, scalability, and clinical usability.

 - Stay current with industry standards (IHE, HL7, FHIR), regulatory considerations (HIPAA, SOC 2), and the evolving radiology vendor ecosystem.
   


WHO YOU ARE:

 - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Biomedical Informatics, or a related technical field.

 - 5+ years of experience in product management, including 3+ years working on technical or platform-level products in healthcare or enterprise software.

 - Deep experience in healthcare integrations—you’ve worked hands-on with systems like Epic Radiant, PowerScribe, or PACS platforms, and understand the intricacies of real-time clinical workflows.

 - Hands-on mindset—you thrive in the details, whether it's writing technical product specs, mapping out integration flows, or debugging implementation blockers with engineering.

 - Excellent communicator—you can break down complex topics for both technical and non-technical audiences, and drive alignment among diverse stakeholders.

 - Customer-focused—you bring empathy for radiologists and healthcare IT teams, and a strong desire to solve real-world clinical problems.

 - Dynamic—you’re comfortable in fast-paced, evolving environments where priorities shift and your ability to deliver results is what sets you apart.


IT’S A PLUS IF YOU ALSO HAVE:

 - Experience building healthcare SaaS products at a growth-stage company.

 - Familiarity with HL7, FHIR, DICOM, and IHE integration standards.

 - Experience with AI/ML-enabled software or data infrastructure.

 - Product ownership across multi-tenant or enterprise-scale platforms.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

 - Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

jobs.title: Director of GTM Finance
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

We’re seeking a Director of GTM Finance to partner with our CFO, CRO, and senior leadership on driving revenue growth and commercial excellence. This role will be the finance owner for our go-to-market engine - covering everything from pipeline generation through to sales and ultimately customer upsell and renewal. You’ll play a critical role in aligning financial strategy with GTM execution, ensuring that Rad AI hits its ambitious growth targets with discipline and precision.

This is a highly visible role at the intersection of Finance and GTM (Marketing, Sales, CS), where you’ll help define our growth trajectory, align teams on how to deliver on that growth, and dive in to help them execute and optimize performance.

What You’ll Do:

  • Partner with CRO & GTM Leaders to drive financial insight across Sales, Marketing, Partnerships, and Customer Success.

  • GTM forecasting: bookings, pipeline coverage, win rates, sales cycle analysis, and productivity metrics.

  • Annual and quarterly planning for headcount, capacity, quota deployment, and compensation structures across GTM.

  • Build and maintain key SaaS unit economics models (CAC, LTV, sales payback, productivity ratios) to inform investment and growth decisions.

  • Analyze sales and marketing funnel efficiency: pipeline health, win/loss trends, campaign ROI, and lead-to-close conversion.

  • Collaborate with RevOps on sales capacity planning, quota models, coverage, and territory design, etc.

  • Provide strategic insight on pricing, packaging, and partner economics to maximize revenue growth and margin profile.

  • Build GTM financial models that support scenario planning, resource allocation, and board-level reporting.

  • Serve as the trusted advisor to GTM leadership, connecting financial insights to commercial execution.

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 8+ years of experience in FP&A, Strategic Finance, or Sales Finance within a SaaS or high-growth technology company; B2B experience required.

  • Deep understanding of SaaS GTM metrics (pipeline coverage, win rates, CAC, LTV, productivity ratios).

  • Strong modeling, forecasting, and analytical skills with the ability to distill insights into executive-ready recommendations.

  • Proven ability to work cross-functionally and influence at all levels, especially with Sales and Marketing executives.

  • Experience building and scaling GTM planning and reporting processes in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

  • Comfortable toggling between strategy and execution; thrives in fast-paced and ambiguous settings.

  • Previous experience working in a high-growth startup environment.

  • Passion for healthcare and/or mission-driven technology is a strong plus.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

  • For roles based outside the US, your recruiter can share more details

At Rad AI, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our recruiters will use email addresses with the domain @radai.com or no-reply@ashbyhq.com.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack - Core Services
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

As part of the Core Services team, you’ll help design the systems and foundations that power Rad AI’s products. Your work is enabling our engineers to deliver reliable, scalable solutions that improve patient care at scale.

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer who thrives on building systems that empower teams and scale effectively. This role focuses on developing templates, libraries, and processes that address underlying challenges and enable consistent, reliable solutions across the organization.

The ideal candidate is fluent in at least one of our core languages — Python, TypeScript, or Go — and approaches technology as a tool for solving meaningful problems. They value clean, maintainable code and believe that exceptional engineering is grounded in thoughtful design, collaboration, and clarity.

They understand both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms, applying each where appropriate. Their experience spans designing and maintaining monolithic and microservice-based architectures, and includes making pragmatic, data-driven decisions to balance scalability with immediate impact.

The engineer is adept at gathering and refining requirements with cross-functional teams, translating complex needs into clear technical plans. They communicate risks early, collaborate to deliver sustainable solutions, and delegate effectively to build trust and achieve predictable, high-quality outcomes. They also lead with curiosity, empathy, and accountability, recognizing that diverse perspectives create stronger, more innovative systems.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable, high-performance systems that enable consistency and reliability across Rad AI’s products.

  • Contribute to large-scale web applications and internal platforms that streamline workflows and increase efficiency for clinicians and internal users.

  • Collaborate on a modern JavaScript (React/TypeScript) frontend application and contribute to shared libraries and patterns that enhance developer productivity.

  • Develop and extend Python (FastAPI) backend services, including REST APIs and ML pipeline integrations, with a focus on maintainability, security, and performance.

  • Partner closely with Product Management, UX, Customer Success, and other stakeholders to gather requirements, shape technical solutions, and iterate quickly based on feedback.

  • Contribute to the architecture and development of both monolithic and microservice systems, ensuring scalability, observability, and maintainability across environments.

  • Write clean, testable, and well-documented code that meets Rad AI’s standards for security, style, and maintainability in a high-scale, HIPAA-compliant environment.

  • Identify opportunities to standardize and abstract solutions through reusable frameworks, templates, and automation that simplify complex systems.

  • Advocate for and implement improvements to product quality, security, and performance with a focus on sustainable, systemic impact.

  • Communicate risks early, propose actionable paths forward, and collaborate across disciplines to drive successful delivery.

Who We’re Looking For:

  • 6+ years of professional experience in software engineering, including leading or owning core systems or platforms.

  • Proficiency in at least one of: Python, TypeScript, or Go (or comparable experience in another modern language).

  • Strong foundation in both object-oriented and functional programming concepts.

  • Hands-on experience with relational (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases, and an understanding of when each is most appropriate.

  • Experience gathering requirements and collaborating cross-functionally to define and deliver solutions.

  • Experience building and supporting both monolithic and microservice architectures, with attention to scalability, reliability, and observability.

  • Demonstrated ability to identify and solve systemic problems through reusable code, shared libraries, and process improvements.

  • Clear and proactive communication skills — able to identify risks early and offer constructive paths forward.

  • Passion for designing foundational tools that simplify complexity and make engineering teams more effective.

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience building internal developer platforms, SDKs, or reusable frameworks.

  • Background in infrastructure automation, CI/CD systems, or service orchestration.

  • Familiarity with observability tooling (e.g., OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana).

  • Experience working in healthcare, AI/ML, or other regulated environments.

  • Experience migrating between architectural patterns (e.g., monolith to microservices).

  • Contributions to open source projects or internal shared codebases.

  • Experience mentoring or supporting peers in technical growth.

  • Enthusiasm for creating an inclusive, collaborative engineering culture that values learning and improvement.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

  • For roles based outside the US, your recruiter can share more details

At Rad AI, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Please be vigilant regarding job scams. We advise all candidates to apply directly through our official careers page. Our recruiters will use email addresses with the domain @radai.com or no-reply@ashbyhq.com.

Why Join Us:

Rad AI’s engineering team is growing quickly for our award-winning product. We are seeking a world-class Engineering Manager to scale our team and drive strategy and execution. As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be responsible for delivering on our product roadmap, partnering cross-functionally across engineering, product, and other organizations, and leading an engineering team where you’ll be responsible for mentorship, career development, and performance management.

Our team moves fast and ships code to production continuously and will rely on our engineering leadership success to increase productivity by removing obstacles and keeping processes lean.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Report into our Director of Engineering to manage a team of software engineers at a variety of levels

  • Cross-functionally partner with other groups, including platform engineering, machine learning, product management to advance product features.

  • Bring clarity to ambiguous situations, ensuring feature development aligns with long-term KPI improvements.

  • Invest in individual growth, enabling your team to deliver with quality and confidence.

  • Collaborate with senior leadership to chart out a strategic direction based on vital business metrics.

  • Prioritize clear, constructive feedback, ensuring everyone on the team is aligned and empowered.

Who We're Looking For:

jobs.title: Lead Product Manager, Artificial Intelligence
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Rad AI

At Rad AI, we’re on a mission to transform healthcare with artificial intelligence. Founded by a radiologist, our AI-driven solutions are revolutionizing radiology—saving time, reducing burnout, and improving patient care. With one of the largest proprietary radiology report datasets in the world, our AI has helped uncover hundreds of new cancer diagnoses and reduced error rates in tens of millions of radiology reports by nearly 50%.

Rad AI has secured over $140M in funding, including a recently oversubscribed Series C ($68M round) led by Transformation Capital, bringing our valuation to $528M. Our investors include Khosla Ventures, World Innovation Lab, Gradient Ventures, Cone Health Ventures, and others—all backing our mission to empower physicians with cutting-edge AI.

Our latest advancements in generative AI are used by thousands of radiologists daily, supporting more than one-third of radiology groups and healthcare systems and nearly 50% of all medical imaging in the U.S. at partners including Cone Health, Jefferson Einstein Health, Geisinger, Guthrie Healthcare System, and Henry Ford Health.

Recognized as one of the most promising healthcare AI companies by CB Insights and AuntMinnie, and ranked by Deloitte as the 19th fastest-growing company in North America, we are building AI-powered solutions that make a real impact. Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join Us:

As a Lead Product Manager, AI, you’ll lead the strategy, development, and launch of Rad AI’s most advanced, AI-driven features—those that harness our proprietary datasets, deep learning models, and generative AI systems to drive measurable improvements in radiologist productivity and patient outcomes.

You’ll work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, product managers, designers, and clinical experts to define, ship, and scale AI-powered experiences that reach thousands of clinicians daily. This is a high-impact role where product strategy meets deep technical understanding of AI systems, user trust, and real-world clinical deployment at scale.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Own the product roadmap for AI-driven features and experiences, from ideation through launch and iteration.

  • Collaborate with ML and data science teams to translate model capabilities into intuitive, high-value user workflows.

  • Drive AI productization—including model evaluation, performance monitoring, safety, and explainability frameworks for clinical environments.

  • Partner with engineering and design to create user experiences that build trust in AI outputs and integrate seamlessly into radiology workflows.

  • Define and track key success metrics, including accuracy, latency, adoption, and user satisfaction.

  • Work with customers and radiologists directly to understand clinical pain points and validate product hypotheses.

  • Contribute to company-wide AI strategy, helping shape how Rad AI leverages large-scale data and generative AI models across our product lines.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with regulatory, privacy, and security teams to ensure AI systems meet healthcare compliance and safety standards.

Who You Are:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related technical field.

  • 10+ years of product management experience, including 3+ years leading AI/ML or data-driven products in production environments.

  • Proven success building and launching AI-powered features at scale, ideally within enterprise SaaS or healthcare technology.

  • Strong understanding of machine learning lifecycles, model evaluation, and human-in-the-loop systems.

  • Excellent communicator who can translate complex AI concepts into clear product strategy and user value.

  • Highly collaborative and comfortable working with ML, data, and engineering teams as well as clinicians and business stakeholders.

  • Customer-obsessed—you’re driven by solving real clinical problems and improving human performance through intelligent systems.

  • Thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with evolving priorities.

It’s a Plus If You Also Have:

  • Experience deploying AI or ML solutions in healthcare or other regulated domains.

  • Understanding of generative AI models (LLMs, multimodal systems) and their application to real-world workflows.

  • Experience managing AI performance monitoring or MLOps systems in production.

  • Previous product ownership across multi-tenant or enterprise-scale platforms.

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

For US-Based Full-Time Roles, Rad AI offers a variety of benefits, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA 

  • 401(k)

  • 11 Paid Company Holidays

  • Location Flexibility (Remote-first company!)

  • Flexible PTO policy

  • Annual company-wide offsite

  • Periodic team offsites

  • Annual equipment stipend

Most recently, Rad AI was named to CNBC’s Disruptor 50 list, highlighting the innovation and momentum behind our mission.

If you’re ready to shape the future of healthcare, we’d love to have you on our team!

Why Join us?

We’re seeking to add a world-class experienced Machine Learning Scientist and hands-on NLP subject matter expert to join our amazing ML team. You will be building state-of-the-art speech and language models to support radiologists and improve clinical outcomes. 

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Develop Advanced Deep Learning Models: Harness the power of deep learning to create sophisticated models capable of performing a range of recognition and generative tasks, specifically tailored to the nuances of clinical data.

  • Innovate in Clinical Problem-Solving: Apply your expertise to solve intricate clinical challenges, contributing directly to real-world healthcare advancements.

  • Collaborative Solution Development: Engage actively with both technical peers and clinical experts to innovate and refine solutions that have a tangible impact in the field of healthcare.

  • Architect Interdisciplinary Solutions: Play a pivotal role in designing solutions that bridge multiple disciplines. Determine the optimal integration points for machine learning in these solutions and conduct objective evaluations of competing methodologies.

  • Research Integration and Experimentation: Stay at the forefront of machine learning advancements by reviewing academic papers, designing experiments, and integrating cutting-edge research into our platform.

  • Mentorship and Collaboration Opportunities: Contribute to the growth of our dynamic Machine Learning Team through mentorship roles and collaborate with our esteemed in-house team of leading clinicians.

Who We’re Looking For:

  • Masters (PhD preferred) in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience 

  • At least 4 post-educational working years of experience

  • Experience developing and testing NLP models (Summarization, Question Answering, ASR) in a commercial or academic setting

  • Experience applying ML solutions to real world problems

  • Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch), common NLP frameworks such as HuggingFace, and open source foundation models like Mistral, Llama and Whisper.

  • Experience with LLMs in production systems

  • Extensive programming experience, with a focus on Python

Nice to Have:

  • MD or PhD in biomedical or related field, or equivalent experience

  • Experience working at an early stage startup 

  • Have successfully published in NLP

  • Experience in healthcare industry or clinical environments

  • Experience working with AWS, GCP or similar

  • Experience working in a HIPAA compliant environment 

  • Experience applying machine learning to health data

Join our world-class team as we build and deploy AI solutions that empower physicians and transform patient care—making a meaningful impact on millions of lives. Driven by our mission,  we prioritize transparency, inclusion, and close collaboration, bringing together exceptional people to revolutionize healthcare. If you're passionate about driving innovation and delivering impactful healthcare solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

To learn more about what it's like to work at Rad AI, visit https://www.radai.com/life-at-rad-ai

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision & Life insurance

  • HSA (with employer match), FSA, & DCFSA
